bio.name: Hank Duhaime
bio.contactMessage: I'm always happy to chat with fellow designers, recruiters, up-and-comers, potential collaborators, or anyone willing to nerd out about theme parks.

aboutParagraphs: Iâ€™m Hank â€” a design technologist who builds playful interactive experiences.
Most recently I've been focused on emergent digital spaces: from AR tools for healthcare to XR, haptics, and AI at Meta Reality Labs.
I thrive where code, hardware, and imagination meet: turning early ideas into prototypes that can be felt, heard, seen, and (sometimes) smelled. Not tasted though, at leastâ€¦ not yet ðŸ¤”
Outside of work, Iâ€™m a hobbyist maker with skills in electronics and 3D printing. My love languages are threaded inserts and programmable LEDs.
I also enjoy teaching others how to bring their own interactive ideas to life â€” whether thatâ€™s wiring a first circuit or helping shape a full installation.

experience.title: Senior Product Design Prototyper
experience.description: Prototyping for R&D in AR/VR to enable design explorations, value assessments, and research studies for emergent research technologies including haptics, AI, wearables, and robotics

experience.title: Experience Designer L1
experience.description: Designed digital products for Mercedes-Benz USA through the creation of sketches, wireframes, interaction flows, and click-through prototypes

experience.title: UX Designer / Engineer
experience.description: Designed, programmed, and shipped 5 mobile AR minigames used in 20+ pediatric hospitals to improve the patient experience

experience.title: Experience Design Itern
experience.description: Developed flow diagrams, videos, and software prototypes to represent interactive physical installations to prospective clients

experience.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
experience.description: Mentored graduate students through the process of concepting, designing, and fabricating interactive physical installations

publications.title: Enabling Immersive, Fantastical Interactions in Virtual Reality Using EMG and Haptics (CHI Workshop, 2025)
Explorations of Wrist Haptic Feedback for AR/VR Interactions with Tasbi (UIST Demo, 2022)
Safecracker: Exploring Immersion Through Audio and Object-Based Controllers (CHI Student Games Competition, 2020)
System and Method for Delivering Augmented Reality Using Scalable Frames to Pre-Existing Media (Utility Patents, 2017)

projects.title: RL Haptics Prototyping
projects.subtitle: Meta Reality Labs Research
projects.description: Selected public prototypes for novel XR interactions enabled by RL-R's cutting-edge haptic technologies

projects.title: ARISE AR Scavenger Hunt
projects.subtitle: SpellBound AR
projects.description: A mobile app that encourages pediatric patients to get up and move by sending them an immersive undersea adventure

projects.title: Use Your Melon Exhibit
projects.subtitle: Georgia Aquarium Partnership
projects.description: A gesture-based interactive that challenges guests of the Georgia Aquarium to a game of echolocation charades while they queue for the dolphin show

projects.title: Safecracker Arcade Game
projects.subtitle: CHI Student Games Competition Winner (2020)
projects.description: An immersive heist game where players race to crack open a safe with their trusty stethoscope

projects.title: Depth Charge Minigame
projects.subtitle: Georgia Tech Student Project
projects.description: A handheld and fully-playable arcade cabinet modeled after the radar console of a submarine

projects.title: Second Story Hardware Experiments
projects.subtitle: Second Story Interactive Studios
projects.description: Hardware experiments built during my summer internship that showcase novel interaction technologies for physical installations
